IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO BUILD BROAD SUPPORT AND FUNDING TO SUPPORT ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECTS/PROGRAMS THAT RESTORE AND ENHANCE THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO IMPROVE THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT OF THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN BY BUILDING BROAD SUPPORT AND FUNDING FOR ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECTS AND PROGRAMS THAT RESTORE AND ENHANCE THE LAKE FOR THE ENJOYMENT OF CURRENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS.
IRS990.Desc: RECREATION: THE TAHOE FUND PROVIDES GRANTS TO CRITICAL ENVIRONMENT IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS IN LAKE TAHOE THAT WILL ENHANCE OUTDOOR RECREATION. IN 2017, THE TAHOE FUND GRANTED MONEY TO THE TAHOE TRANSPORATION DISTRICT FOR THE FIRST SECTION OF THE NEW BIKE PATH FROM INCLINE VILLAGE TO SAND HARBOR. TAHOE FUND ALSO SUPPORTED EFFORTS TO RESTORE THE INCLINE FLUME, AND PROVIDED FUNDING FOR A NEW LAKE TAHOE BIKE MAP.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CONSERVATION: THE TAHOE FUND PROVIDES GRANTS TO CRITICAL ENVIRONMENT IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS IN LAKE TAHOE THAT WILL HELP TO RESTORE LAKE CLARITY. THE TAHOE FUND AWARDED A GRANT TO THE TAHOE RESOURCE CONSERVATION DISTRICT TO ACQUIRE JOHNSON MEADOW, THE MOST IMPAIRED WATERSHED IN TAHOE, AND A GRANT TO PURCHASE BOTTOM BARRIERS TO REMOVE AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES FROM THE LAKE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: STEWARDSHIP: THE TAHOE FUND EXECUTES INITIATIVES AND PROVIDES GRANTS TO CRITICAL ENVIRONMENT IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS IN LAKE TAHOE THAT ENCOURAGE GREATER STEWARDSHIP OF THE TAHOE BASIN. TAHOE FUND AWARDED A GRANT TO FUND THE GENERATION GREEN PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES SUMMER WORK TO UNDERSERVED YOUTH WITH THE FOREST SERVCE. TAHOE FUND CONTINUED TO DEVELOP AND EXPAND THE REGIONAL STEWARDSHIP CAMPAIGN CALLED TAKE CARE AND AWARDED GRANTS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL NEWSPAPER TAHOE IN-DEPTH AND THE STATE OF THE LAKE REPORT. TAHOE FUND ALSO FUNDED A SIGN AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE BASIN IN MEMORY OF FALLEN FIREFIGHTER MIKEY HALLENBECK AS A REMINDER OF FIRE SAFETY.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Due to a change in accounting period the year 2014 is a short period (9 month period) from 7/1/14-3/31/15.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: Beneficial Interest in Assets at Foundat

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The fund was established by the board of directors to support the operating expenses of the organization. The current goal is to build the fund to $1,000,000 with reinvestment of earnings and future restricted and unrestricted donations.

Tahoe Fund is exempt from federal income taxes under the provisions of Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3), and a similar exemption for California purposes. Tahoe Fund is not classified as a private foundation. Unrelated business income, if any, is taxed at regular corporate tax rates.Management believes Tahoe Fund has met the requirements to maintain its tax-exempt status and has no income subject to unrelated business income tax, therefore, no provision for taxes has been provided in these financial statements. Tahoe Funds Federal tax returns for the past three years and State tax returns for the last four years are subject to examination by tax authorities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CA Dept of Forestry & Fire Pr

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UPON AWARDING A GRANT, A WRITTEN REQUEST FOR A FINANCIAL REPORT OF HOW THE GRANT FUNDS WERE SPENT WITHIN 120 DAYS IS SUPPLIED. IF THE REPORT IS NOT PROVIDED, WE FOLLOW UP WITH THE GRANTEE TO UNDERSTAND WHY NOT. WE SOMETIMES GRANT EXTENSIONS IF A PROJECT HAS A REASONABLE DELAY. ADDITIONALLY, GRANTS TO PUBLIC AGENCIES FOR PROJECTS THAT RECEIVE STATE AND/OR FEDERAL FUNDING, REQUIRE THEM TO MEET FEDERAL OR STATE AUDITING GUIDELINES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 7: Non-Fixed payments not listed above
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CEO is paid a bonus determined by the compensation committee based on the success of completing a listing of pre-defined tasks/goals in key areas such as; environmental project goals, board development, professional development, marketing/PR, donor campaigns, financial management, and completion of program related tasks. The bonus for 2017 was derived after taking into consideration achievements accomplished over an eighteen (18) month period.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d: Other Program Services Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: RECREATION: THE TAHOE FUND PROVIDES GRANTS TO CRITICAL ENVIRONMENT IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS IN LAKE TAHOE THAT WILL ENHANCE OUTDOOR RECREATION. IN 2017, THE TAHOE FUND GRANTED MONEY TO THE TAHOE TRANSPORATION DISTRICT FOR THE FIRST SECTION OF THE NEW BIKE PATH FROM INCLINE VILLAGE TO SAND HARBOR. TAHOE FUND ALSO SUPPORTED EFFORTS TO RESTORE THE INCLINE FLUME, AND PROVIDED FUNDING FOR A NEW LAKE TAHOE BIKE MAP. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 5: FOREST HEALTH: THE TAHOE FUND PROVIDES GRANTS TO RESTORE THE FORESTS IN THE TAHOE BASIN TO MAKE THEM MORE RESILIENT TO CATASTROPHIC WILDFIRE. THE TAHOE FUND GRANTED MONEY TO THE US FOREST SERVICE TO REPLANT TREES AT THE SITE OF THE EMERALD FIRE BURN AREA. THE TAHOE FUND ALSO GRANTED FUNDS TO UC DAVIS-TAHOE ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH CENTER TO COLLECT AND GROW SUGAR PINE SEEDLINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: STAFF IS RESPONSIBLE FOR PREPARING THE 990 WITH THE AID OF A PROFESSIONAL ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE BEFORE BEING DISTRIBUTED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR REVIEW AFTER WHICH IT IS SUBMITTED TO THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO RE-SIGN THE POLICY ANNUALLY AND FILL OUT AN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE FORM AT THE ANNUAL MEETING. BOARD CHAIR REVIEWS ALL POLICIES AND MAKES THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AWARE OF ANY CONFLICTS. THE BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY NEW CONFLICTS AS SOON AS THEY ARISE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CEO's initial salary was set by the board in consultation with an outside hiring agency. The hiring agency did a comparability study of similar organizations in the area. The CEO is reviewed annually by the compensation committee with input from the full board at which time the compensation is reviewed and then subsequently approved by the board as part of the annual budget approval process.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board members are not compensated and there are no key employees

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND OTHER DOCUMENTS SUBJECT TO PUBLIC DISCLOSURE ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. All documents are available in pdf and can be emailed or printed and sent via us mail per the preference of the requester. Requests can be made via phone, email, or snail mail.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other Changes In Net Assets Or Fund Balances - Other Decreases
PART IX STATEMENT OF FUNCTIONAL EXPENSES, LINE 25
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The fundraising expenses of the organization are much higher on a percentage basis of total expenses than most non-profit organizations because the mission of organization is to raise funds for projects that restore and enhance Lake Tahoe.
